sections.heading: GST Amendment: A Comprehensive Guide
content: When business information changes, the process of updating or correcting details in an existing GST registration is referred to as a GST Amendment.
To ensure compliance with GST laws, registered taxpayers are required to update such changes within 15 days of the event.

sections.heading: GST Amendment: Modification to Company Name
content: GST registration must be updated to reflect any legal name changes made to a business, such as rebranding or ownership changes.

list.title: Important Points
points: Submit FORM GST REG-14 within 15 days of the name change through the GST portal.
The application is reviewed and approved by the tax officer, usually within 15 working days.
The amendment becomes effective from the date the business name change occurs after approval.

sections.heading: GST Amendment: Change in Place of Business
content: GST registration needs to be amended if the principal place of business or any additional business location changes due to relocation or expansion.

list.title: Important Points
points: Submit FORM GST REG-14 with valid address proof such as a rent agreement or electricity bill.
The amendment must be filed within 15 days of the change event.
The tax officer generally approves the amendment within 15 working days.

sections.heading: GST Amendment: Change in Promoter or Management Details
content: GST registration must be updated whenever there is a change in promoters such as partners, directors, trustees, Karta (HUF), CEOs, or managing committee members.

list.title: Important Points
points: File the amendment within 15 days of addition, removal, or retirement of a promoter.
Submit identity proof, address proof, and declarations for new promoters.
The tax officer reviews and approves the application within approximately 15 working days.

sections.heading: GST Amendment: Change in Email Address or Mobile Number
content: Updating the email address or mobile number linked to GST registration is simple but very important for receiving compliance alerts and notifications.

list.title: Important Points
points: Changes can be made directly on the GST portal after OTP-based verification.
Digital signature verification by the authorised signatory is required.
Officer approval or FORM GST REG-14 submission is not required.

sections.heading: GST Amendment: PAN Changes Not Allowed
content: PAN modifications cannot be made through the GST amendment process since GST registration is PAN-based.

list.title: Important Points
points: Change of PAN or business constitution (e.g., proprietorship to company) is not permitted via amendment.
A new GST registration must be applied for using FORM GST REG-01 with the updated PAN.
The existing GST registration must be cancelled to maintain GST identity and tax integrity.

sections.heading: Overview of the GST Amendment Procedure
content: Most GST amendments must be filed within 15 days from the date of change.
Core field amendments such as business name, address, and promoter details require tax officer approval.
Non-core fields like email and mobile number are updated automatically upon submission.
If the tax officer does not act within the prescribed time, the amendment may be deemed approved.
